question_text:
Question 55 
[Geotechnical Engineering : Shear Strength of Soil] 
 
A drained triaxial test was conducted on a saturated sand specimen using a stress-path triaxial testing 
system. The specimen failed when the axial stress reached a value of 
2
100 kN/m
  from an initial confining
pressure of 
2
300 kN/m
 . The angle of shearing plane (in degrees) with respect to horizontal is 
________________ (rounded off to the nearest integer). 
Ans. 30 to 30
explanation_text:
Sol. 
In stress-path triaxial testing, we can control both radial and axial stress.
